oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter regarding testing Grassmere soil samples
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from William D. Bishop from the Department of Agriculture addressed to Elise Croft regarding soil samples done on the Grassmere property. This is the second letter since 1951. The results this time are medium level of acidity, high phosphate and high potash. The letter list suggestions about using limestone and fertilizer before seeding.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bishop, William D.; University of Tennessee (Knoxville campus). Agricultural Extension Service
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Soils--Sampling; Phosphates; Potash; Soil acidity; Ammonium nitrate; Limestone
Dirt; Fertilizers
